entry.title: Reading notes of 'The Economist'
entry.content: ABSTRACT: “The Ecnomomist”, founded in London in 1843 and known for its neutrality, is an English-language weekly magazine-format newpaper. From the perspective of learning english, reading “The Economist” is an excellent choice because lots of elegant words and sentences are used appropriately which make up numerous beautiful artiles. Likewise, it is a newpaper that conveies truth and its unique standpoints regarding to famous figures and events all over the world. In the process of reading it, our thoughts will be enriched, as well as our English skills. The Economist (Aug 3rd, 2019)ABSTRACT: I am writing this essay to record the key points of three articles which are published on the “China” section in “Economist 20190803”. Jobless graduates / Skilled but jobless / Idle hands Hong Kong’s protests / Reclaiming Hong Kong / Protest, but no movement Chaguan The semiotics（n. 符号学） of meeting rooms / Meeting room politics / Armchair warriors 1. Idle hands Fig 1 China’s economy, influenced by the trade war with America, is growing at its slowest pace in nearly 30 years. Meanwhile, Chinese universities contributed 8.3m graduates this summer, nearly 1.5 times as many as ten years ago. In addition, the retrenchment of visa policies in weastern countries will foster the returning of more oversea students. It’s safe to say that the job application of Chinese graduates this year is going to much tougher than ever before. Fortunately, guaranteeing the employment rate is the first priority of government, for the sake of social stability. Chinese government have issued many policies to stimulate the recruitment of the enterprises. But inevitablely, the proporation of fresh graduates who have found full-time jobs within 6 months of graduation have fallen around 4% since 2014, and the average monthly salary for new graduates also fell largely from 2015 to 2017. Though the employment situation is much more worse, it only brings threats to those who are not well skilled. We have reasons to believe that as long as one is skilled and ready, there will be chance for him/her. 2. Protest, but no movement Fig 2 Nowadays, Hong Kong is experiencing an unprecedent riot which have paralysed the transportation, business and routine life of Hong Kong. The central government have reiterated its unchangeable stance toward Hong Kong issues. The local garrison（n. / vt. 卫戍，驻守）of the People’s Liberation Army (PLA) also announce its confidence of coping with the severe situation in Hong Kong. As what my friends sees and hears, the demonstration kept mounting up and evoking numerous riots, which interrupted the regular order of Hong Kong largely. While in the article of “Economist”, it should support the demonstration and condemn the government for lacking sincerity about process of electing chief executive freely. From where I stand, I indeed hope that Hong Kong can return to peace and prosperous. The apeal for general election is more likely to be used and provoked by capitalism and politicians. What is the priority we need to do, I guess, is reading more and thinking more. 3. Chaguan: Armchair warriorsChaguanis a special column of China section in ‘Economist’, just named after a classical novel in China mainland. In the famous book, the author ‘Laoshe’ described the decrepit process of an old Beijing teahouse between 1920s and 1940s. More importantly, it reflected ups and downs of the whole modern society of China. Analogously, the special column is aiming to point out problems of China and bring out corresponding tactics. Fig 3 This article talked about the armchair used at the occasions of the reception meeting for foreigh leaders. As it says, it is a unique phenomenon of China to hold a meeting at this kind of horseshoe pattern office. And they think it’s not only unconfortable for the occupants to sit but also inconvenient to exchange opinions with aides and companions. Yes, there are some demerits of this kind of meeting, and China is also absorbing the experience and holding more and more bussiness pattern meetings. But there is no deny that armchair is a symbol of tranditional culture and deserves to be respected. Pragmatism is definitely right, while advocating tranditional cultures is also reasonable. The Economist (Aug 10th, 2019)ABSTRACT: After reading the three articles of “China” section in “Economist 20190810”, I am willing to write some comments on these issues respectively. There is no doubt that “Economist” is a famous and relatively neutral media, but we also need have our own thought. Tensions with Taiwan / Cross-strait relations / Sunset for backpackers Saving old buildings / Historic preservation / Old buildings, new chic Chaguan The Huawei conundrum / Distrust and verify 1. Sunset for backpackers Fig 4 Cross-strait relations have been improved and enhanced by the efforts of many righteous mainlanders and taiwaneses in the past decades. Peace and cooperation are definitely a win-win choice for both mainland and Taiwan. As the article said, mainland tourists made up two-fifths of all visitors in Taiwan five years ago. Even now, visitors form mainland still accounted for over one-quarter of Taiwan’s tourist arrivals in the first half of this year. Meanwhile, mainland also benefits a lot in the process of bilateral trade and investment with Taiwan. The technologies, commodities and capitals, etc. of Taiwan was indispensable in the reform and opening up process of mainland. While there inevitably exists some disharmony in cross-strait relations considering the complex problems left over by history. Fortunately, the overall situation has been under control in most periods. But Taiwan’s ruling Democratic Progressive Party, abhoring the idea of unification and supporting the anti-government protesters in Hong Kong overtly, greatly annoyed the central government of mainland. And a sudden suspension of solo-travel programme for mainlanders just ensued from it. This incident just coincides with the regional leader’s and legislative elections. We just hope that a more sincere and friendly leader will emerge and win in the important election. 2. Old buildings, new chic Fig 5 This article focus on the topic of historic buildings preservation in Guangzhou city, China. I would like to refer to it as a piece of news rather than a review for any subjective idea that was not found in this article. This article just mentioned the outward appearance of some old villas and alleys, as well as an NGO devoting to protect these old buildings in China. 3. Chaguan: Distrust and verify Fig 6 As the trade war between China and America going on, Huawei, a high-tech firm of China, is bearing the brunt of American sanctions. In terms of the proper reactions and abundant technical achievements, Huawei has been regarded as the national pride domestically. While in the era of globalization, being landed in the American Commerce Department’s “entity list” is definitely a vital blow for such a multinational corporation. Though being confronted with the vital challenge, Huawei is still progressing in its seaonal revenue. But trust and credit are of most importance for a network device supplier. Huawei apparently has been aware of it and adopted various methods to restore its credit to foreign countries, including the openness of its labortary to foreign journalists recently. Huawei also bring up two solutions to mitigate the security worries that other countries concern about. The first solution, regarded as the persuasive on by the article of Economist, is to treat distrust in global supply chains as a technical challenge, rather than a political one. In that case, distrust can never be eliminated but may be mitigated. As a Huawei executive mentioned, the cyber-security should abide by the “ABC” princle, that is “Assume nothing. Believe nobody. Check everything”. The second solution, deemed to be less persuasive, is to give written or verbal assurances from the Chinese government. Anyway, we are hoping the merchandising environment will be much fair and transparent. Huawei, come on. The Economist (Aug 17th, 2019)ABSTRACT: The articles in “China” section of “Economist 20190817” contain some opinions violating our common sense to some degree. I am eager to express my ideas against these perspectives embodied in the magazine. Though as we all know, “Economist” is a media well-known for advocating and supporting freedom and objectivism. But what the experience of China’s development told us is that absolute freedom may not benefit every folk instead give the chance to the expansion of capitalism. entry.title: VPS网络中继及加速
entry.content: 摘要：VPS作为虚拟个人主机，在建站、网络代理等方面具有重要作用。利用VPS搭建个人代理服务器，其原理就是购买境外虚拟个人主机VPS，然后使用加密通信软件建立境内客户端与该境外主机之间的通信，将境内需要访问网站的请求转发给境外主机，由境外主机下载数据后回传，从而实现网络中继的效果。 VPS网络中继及加速VPS主机选择与购买首先需要选择一个境外的VPS提供商，老左博客里面有时候会有推荐，其中一些VPS提供商会有不同程度的新人优惠，注意薅羊毛。注册后需要充值一定金额才能领取优惠，部分VPS提供商支持支付宝，有的只能用双币信用卡或paypal支付。 注册完成后在其网站购买VPS，选择最低配置的主机即可。价格因供应商而异，“搬瓦工”这个主机提供商可能稍微便宜点，但是据说用的人多速度不够好。其他的linode、Digitalocean等都可以尝试和比较。总体来说价格一般是5美元/月。 购买VPS的过程中需要选择主机的相关信息，主机机房这个最好通过测速确定，不是离得越近越好，比如部分商家的新加坡机房到大陆是绕道欧洲的，延时较高，还不如美国本土的机房。然后操作系统一般选择Ubuntu16.04×64，由于VPS和我们的电脑之间一般通过SSH连接，所以需要安装putty软件，利用putty gen程序生成一对SSH的公钥和私钥，公钥上传到VPS主机端，私钥自己留着后续通过putty或其他软件验证登录。 与VPS远程通信配置与VPS主机的通信除了用上述的putty，我更推荐使用MobaXterm，这个软件除了支持命令行会话，还支持ftp文件传输等其他功能，比putty强大的多。 通过设置IP地址、接入端口、私钥、登录名等信息后，建立与VPS主机的会话，通过命令行操控远端的Linux系统，安装对应的软件，编辑配置文件等。 VPS主机服务端配置——使用shadowsocks选择aes-256-cfb加密时，使用如下代码。 12345678910111213141516171819202122sudo apt-get update # 更新系统组件sudo apt-get upgrade # 升级系统组件sudo apt-get install python-pip # 安装python-pip安装器，因为shadowsocks是基于python的pip install shadowsocks # 注释掉因为这种内置安装的是2.8版本，不支持更优的aes-256-gcm加密方式 cd /etc# ===== 创建shadowsocks的配置文件 =======sudo touch ss_conf.json # 在/etc文件夹创建shadowsocks配置文件ss_conf.jsonsudo vim ss_conf.json # 编辑配置文件，按i键进入插入模式{"server":"159.89.129.44", # 服务器IP"server_port":8388, # 服务器端口号"local_address":"127.0.0.1", # 本地IP"local_port":1080, # 本地端口号"password":"abcdefg", # 密码"timeout":300, # 延时"method":"aes-256-cfb"}# ======shadowsocks配置文件完毕 ========ssserver -c /etc/ss_conf.json -d start # 启动shadowsocks服务器端服务cd /etcsudo vim rc.local # 修改启动文件，将shadowsocks服务加入到开机启动项# 将'ssserver -c /etc/ss_conf.json -d start' 命令加入到'exit 0'代码之前 选择使用aes-128/256-gcm的加密方式时，由于需要安装libsodium组件，所以比较繁琐，代码及说明展示如下： 一般来说选择aes-256-cfb加密即可，不必如此麻烦使用gcm加密。 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536sudo apt-get update # 更新系统组件sudo apt-get upgrade # 升级系统组件sudo apt-get install python-pip # 安装python-pip安装器，因为shadowsocks是基于python的# pip install shadowsocks # 注释掉因为这种内置安装的是2.8版本，不支持更优的aes-256-gcm加密方式 pip install https://github.com/shadowsocks/shadowsocks/archive/master.zip -U # 从源码直接安装3.0版本# ===== 会提示缺少libsodium组件，需要下载源码安装 =====wget https://download.libsodium.org/libsodium/releases/LATEST.tar.gz # 下载libsodium的源码tar zxf LATEST.tar.gz # 解压源码cd libsodium* # 进入解压后的libsodium源码文件夹./configure # 编译libsodium源码sudo make && sudo make install # 配置及安装源码cd /etc # 进入/etc文件夹sudo vim ld.so.conf # 修改libsodium的配置文件，按i进入插入模式，在该配置文件中加入以下内容/lib/usr/lib64/usr/local/lib # 录入完毕，按esc进入命令模式，使用：wq保存退出sudo ldconfig # 更新lidsodium的配置# ===== libsodium组件安装完成 ==========cd /etc# ===== 创建shadowsocks的配置文件 =======sudo touch ss_conf.json # 在/etc文件夹创建shadowsocks配置文件ss_conf.jsonsudo vim ss_conf.json # 编辑配置文件，按i键进入插入模式{"server":"159.89.129.44", # 服务器IP"server_port":8388, # 服务器端口号"local_address":"127.0.0.1", # 本地IP"local_port":1080, # 本地端口号"password":"abc", # 密码"timeout":300, # 延时"method":"aes-256-cfb" # 加密方式，在此选择aes-128-gcm，不知道能不能防止被封IP，cfb是确定不能逃脱厄运了}# ======shadowsocks配置文件完毕 ========ssserver -c /etc/ss_conf.json -d start # 启动shadowsocks服务器端服务cd /etcsudo vim rc.local # 修改启动文件，将shadowsocks服务加入到开机启动项# 将'ssserver -c /etc/ss_conf.json -d start' 命令加入到'exit 0'代码之前 使用锐速加速，一般需要更换内核并安装锐速，比较复杂，所幸有牛人制作了一键安装脚本，亲测在ubuntu16.04上可用。 12wget xiaofd.github.io/ruisu.sh && bash ruisu.sh # 下载锐速软件和系统内核包并运行ps aux | grep appex # 查看安装锐速是否运行 VPS主机服务端配置——使用V2ray参考一个私人博客的配置，锐速加速仍可以使用上述的一键安装脚本。 V2ray是一种新的网络代理软件，其中有自己的vmess协议，也支持shadowsocks的协议。首先下载V2ray软件并安装： 123wget https://install.direct/go.sh # 下载安装脚本bash go.sh # 安装V2ray软件systemctl start v2ray # 启动V2ray软件 我的服务器端配置文件如下，可以支持一个人通过v2ray的vmess协议访问，还可以支持另外两个人通过shadowsocks以不同的端口号访问，需要进入/etc/v2ray/config.json修改配置文件： 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253{ "log": { "access": "/var/log/v2ray/access.log", "error": "/var/log/v2ray/error.log", "loglevel": "warning" }, "inbound": { "port": 1234, //vmess协议的端口号，自己选择，但是客户端和服务器要相同 "protocol": "vmess", "settings": { "clients": [{ "id": "e685a7a0-8789-4595-9d17-f7b231f4abff", //相当于SSR中的密码，服务器和客户端要相同,通过（https://www.uuidgenerator.net/）生成 "alterId": 77 //自己选择，服务器和客户端相同 }] }, "streamSettings":{ //mkcp加速 "network":"mkcp", "kcpSettings":{ "mtu":1350, "tti":20, "uplinkCapacity":10, "downlinkCapacity":1000, "congestion":false, "readBufferSize":1, "writeBufferSize":1, "header":{ "type":"none" } } } }, "inboundDetour": [{ //shadowsocks协议部分，我这里部署了两个端口都是ss协议，你可以不部署 "protocol": "shadowsocks", "port": 5555, //端口号自己选择 "settings": { "method": "aes-256-gcm", //协议自己选择 "password": "abc", //密码自己设定 "udp":true } },{ "protocol": "shadowsocks", "port": 6666, //端口号自己选择 "settings": { "method": "aes-256-gcm", //协议自己选择 "password": "abc", //密码自己设定 "udp":true } }], "outbound": { "protocol": "freedom", "settings": {} }} 我的客户端（即我的私人电脑）的v2ray配置如下： 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100101102103104105106107108109110111112113114{ "log": { "loglevel": "warning" }, "inbound": { "listen": "127.0.0.1", "port": 1081, //监听端口 "protocol": "socks", "domainOverride":["tls","http"], "settings": { "auth": "noauth", "udp": true } }, "outbound": { "protocol": "vmess", "settings": { "vnext":[ { "address":"68.183.186.247", //你的VPS的ip "port":1234, //和服务器的端口号对应 "users":[ { "id":"e685a7a0-8789-4595-9d17-f7b231f4abff", //和服务器的id要对应 "level":1, "alterId":77 //和服务器的要对应 } ] } ] }, "streamSettings":{ "network":"mkcp", "kcpSettings":{ "mtu":1350, "tti":20, "uplinkCapacity":10, "downlinkCapacity":100, "congesion":false, "readBufferSize":1, "writeBufferSize":1, "header":{ "type":"none" } } }, "mux": {"enabled": true} }, "outboundDetour":[ { "protocol": "freedom", "settings": {}, "tag": "direct" } ], "routing": { "strategy": "rules", "settings": { "rules": [ { "type": "field", "port": "54-79", "outboundTag": "direct" }, { "type": "field", "port": "81-442", "outboundTag": "direct" }, { "type": "field", "port": "444-65535", "outboundTag": "direct" }, { "type": "field", "domain": [ "gc.kis.scr.kaspersky-labs.com" ], "outboundTag": "direct" }, { "type": "chinasites", "outboundTag": "direct" }, { "type": "field", "ip": [ "0.0.0.0/8", "10.0.0.0/8", "100.64.0.0/10", "127.0.0.0/8", "169.254.0.0/16", "172.16.0.0/12", "192.0.0.0/24", "192.0.2.0/24", "192.168.0.0/16", "198.18.0.0/15", "198.51.100.0/24", "203.0.113.0/24", "::1/128", "fc00::/7", "fe80::/10" ], "outboundTag": "direct" }, { "type": "chinaip", "outboundTag": "direct" } ] } }} 客户端的使用在V2ray的客户端或者shadowsocks的客户端配置完成后，对于电脑来说，还需要在使用Chrome或Firefox浏览器，安装SwitchySharp插件，在其中配置科学上网的选项，指定本地监测端口和IP地址，需要科学上网时切换到该选项，不需要科学上网时选择直连。 对于手机用户来说，下载shadowsocks并修改相关信息即可使用，较为简单。

entry.title: 基于github的博客搭建记录
entry.content:
摘要：本文主要介绍如何使用github和已有的静态博客框架hexo搭建自己的个人博客，以及博客的相关设置和外观美化方法。 基于静态博客主流框架hexoGithub新建username.github.io仓库并初始化 username表示Github的账户名，使用该名字创建公有化仓库； 电脑端安装hexo及其依赖项Windows 下载并安装Git； 在站点下载Node.js下载并安装； 打开Git bash，使用npm安装hexo，输入$ npm install -g hexo-cli； 新建本地hexo站点目录并加载next主题 在Git bash中使用hexo建立本地站点目录； 123$ cd <parental folder>$ hexo init <folder>$ npm install # 可能也不需要这一步 新建完成后，站点目录如下： 1234567.├── _config.yml├── package.json├── scaffolds├── source| └── _posts└── themes 加载next主题； 在Git bash中使用代码加载next主题到对应themes文件夹： 1$ git clone https://github.com/iissnan/hexo-theme-next themes/next 开启本地服务查看站点效果 在站点配置文件_config.yml中修改theme: next，以启用主题； 可在主题配置文件./theme/next/_config.yml中修改scheme: Gemini来改变不同主题风格； 使用hexo的本地服务查看主题效果： 12$ hexo clean # 清除缓存$ hexo s --debug # 启动本地服务器并开启调试模式，注意必须要站点目录下操作 此时，即可访问http://localhost:4000，检查站点是否正常运行。 配置站点文件和主题文件修改站点文件-config.yml 设置站点语言为汉语：language: zh-Hans； 设置网站基本信息： 12345678# Sitetitle: The name of your bolgsubtitle:description: The description of you blogkeywords: Technology, Machine Learning, Seismology, Readingauthor: zhangzlanguage: zh-Hanstimezone: 修改主题文件./theme/next/-config.yml 设置网页显示菜单项： 123456789menu: home: / || home archives: /archives/ || archive tags: /tags/ || tags about: /about/ || user #categories: /categories/ || th #schedule: /schedule/ || calendar #sitemap: /sitemap.xml || sitemap #commonweal: /404/ || heartbeat 设置菜单项的图标，支持Font Awesome图标的名字： 123456789menu_icons: enable: true # Icon Mapping. home: home about: user categories: th tags: tags/ archives: archive commonweal: heartbeat 进入./theme/next/languages/zh-Han.yml设置菜单项对应显示文本： 12345678910menu: home: 首页 archives: 归档 categories: 分类 tags: 标签 about: 关于 search: 搜索 schedule: 日程表 sitemap: 站点地图 commonweal: 公益404 设置网页侧栏： 1234567891011121314sidebar: # Sidebar Position, available value: left | right (only for Pisces | Gemini). position: left #position: right # Sidebar Display, available value (only for Muse | Mist): # - post expand on posts automatically. Default. # - always expand for all pages automatically # - hide expand only when click on the sidebar toggle icon. # - remove Totally remove sidebar including sidebar toggle. display: post #display: always #display: hide #display: remove 设置头像： 将头像图片放置到目录./theme/next/source/images/avatar.jpg，修改主题配置文件： 1234# Sidebar Avatar# in theme directory(source/images): /images/avatar.gif# in site directory(source/uploads): /uploads/avatar.gifavatar: /images/avatar.jpg 内容设置 为分类页面（标签、分类）进行配置： 12$ hexo new page tags # 新建标签页面$ hexo new page catagories # 新建分类页面 在source文件夹下回出现tags和catagories目录，进入修改相应的文件index.md： 1234567title: 标签date: 2019-07-25 15:11:25type: "tags"title: 关于date: 2019-07-25 16:29:33type: "about" 修改文章内链接文本样式，将链接文本设置为蓝色，鼠标划过时文字颜色加深，并显示下划线，找到文件 themes
ext\source\css_custom\custom.styl ，添加如下 css 样式： 12345678.post-body p a { color: #0593d3; border-bottom: none; &:hover { color: #0477ab; text-decoration: underline; }} 添加文章字数统计、阅读时长（next主题已经集成） Hexo 提供了 hexo-wordcount 插件，只需要安装插件然后开启功能: 第一步：安装 word_count 插件，在博客根目录下打开终端：npm install hexo-wordcount --save; 第二步：在主题配置文件 themes
ext\config.yml 中打开 post_wordcount 统计功能： 12345678# Post wordcount display settings# Dependencies: https://github.com/willin/hexo-wordcountpost_wordcount:item_text: truewordcount: true # 单篇 字数统计min2read: true # 单篇 阅读时长totalcount: false # 网站 字数统计separated_meta: true 如果仅仅只是打开 wordcount、min2read，部署之后会发现文章的【字数统计】和【阅读时长】后面没有对应的 xxx 字，xx 分钟等字样，只有光秃秃的数字在那里。 解决方案：找到	hemes
ext\layout_macro\post.swig 文件，将“字”、“分钟” 字样添加到如下位置即可。 1234567<span title="{{ __('post.wordcount') }}"> {{ wordcount(post.content) }} 字</span> ...<span title="{{ __('post.min2read') }}"> {{ min2read(post.content) }} 分钟</span> 如何正常显示数学公式 更改hexo的markdown渲染引擎，从hexo-renderer-marked改为hexo-renderer-kramed，在博客文件夹根目录下运行命令行，运行命令： 12npm uninstall hexo-renderer-marked --savenpm install
